content.raw: Thanks Ian, I'm afraid that we are not in front of an ABI breakage but some [other memory problem related to plugin type](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2279/core-dump-with-gazebo-81-in#comment-36960625)
content.html: Thanks Ian, I'm afraid that we are not in front of an ABI breakage but some other memory problem related to plugin type

pullrequest.title: Fix ABI breakage in gazebo 8.1.0 release (issue #2279)

content.html:
not sure if this makes any difference but we could make the variable static so we can use it later in the other function:

diff -r 4633c73e3e5e gazebo/gui/GuiIface.cc
--- a/gazebo/gui/GuiIface.cc    Wed May 17 18:49:51 2017 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/gui/GuiIface.cc    Thu May 18 11:52:51 2017 -0700
@@ -57,8 +57,6 @@

 boost::property_tree::ptree g_propTree;

-// Names of all GUI plugins loaded at start. Parsed from command line arguments.
-std::vector<std::string> g_plugins_to_load;

 using namespace gazebo;

@@ -188,6 +186,8 @@
     std::vector<std::string> pp =
       vm["gui-plugin"].as<std::vector<std::string> >();

+
+    static std::vector<std::string> g_plugins_to_load;
     for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator iter = pp.begin();
          iter != pp.end(); ++iter)
     {
@@ -366,6 +366,8 @@
             "Main window's RenderWidget must have been created");

   // Load each plugin
+
+  static std::vector<std::string> g_plugins_to_load;
   for (auto iter = g_plugins_to_load.begin();
        iter != g_plugins_to_load.end(); ++iter)
   {
@@ -405,6 +407,7 @@

     gzlog << "Loaded GUI plugin[" << _filename << "]\n";
   }
+  g_plugins_to_load.clear();

 #ifndef _WIN32
   // Now that we're about to run, install a signal handler to allow for

if we can bring AddPlugins back, that would be great

pull_request.title: Fix ABI breakage in gazebo 8.1.0 release (issue #2279)

update.description:
The ABI checker did not detect the failure but it was easy to trigger in the `gazebo_ros_pkgs` just running an empty world. Bisecting the changes leaded me to commit 093374a .

I'm pretty sure that one of the problem was to add the overloaded method `AddPlugin`. This could break the ABI if the method was not overloaded before. However just renaming it was not enough in my testing to solve the problem and I found needed to remove also the `AddPlugins` method to solve totally the breakage.
update.title: Fix ABI breakage in gazebo 8.1.0 release (issue #2279)

pullrequest.title: Fix ABI breakage in gazebo 8.1.0 release (issue #2279)

content.html:
Giving another look and in the presence of this error in your branch, my hypothesis now is that the adittion of the g_plugins_to_load vector to the class is working as an addition of a private member and thus altering the binary size and breaking the ABI.

If I made this stupid change (that breaks functionality) the ABI dissapeared:

+++ b/gazebo/gui/GuiIface.cc    Thu May 18 18:28:45 2017 +0200
@@ -57,9 +57,6 @@

 boost::property_tree::ptree g_propTree;

-// Names of all GUI plugins loaded at start. Parsed from command line arguments.
-std::vector<std::string> g_plugins_to_load;
-
 using namespace gazebo;

 gui::ModelRightMenu *g_modelRightMenu = NULL;
@@ -188,6 +185,9 @@
     std::vector<std::string> pp =
       vm["gui-plugin"].as<std::vector<std::string> >();

+    // Names of all GUI plugins loaded at start. Parsed from command line arguments.
+    std::vector<std::string> g_plugins_to_load;
+
     for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator iter = pp.begin();
          iter != pp.end(); ++iter)
     {
@@ -366,6 +366,8 @@
             "Main window's RenderWidget must have been created");

   // Load each plugin
+  std::vector<std::string> g_plugins_to_load;
+  
   for (auto iter = g_plugins_to_load.begin();
        iter != g_plugins_to_load.end(); ++iter)
   {

```
======= Backtrace: =========
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x777e5)[0x7f0b218517e5]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x7fe0a)[0x7f0b21859e0a]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(cfree+0x4c)[0x7f0b2185d98c]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libxcb.so.1(+0xadc8)[0x7f0b0e895dc8]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libxcb.so.1(+0xc68c)[0x7f0b0e89768c]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libX11.so.6(+0x3d0e8)[0x7f0b187ec0e8]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libX11.so.6(+0x3d24b)[0x7f0b187ec24b]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libX11.so.6(_XEventsQueued+0x5d)[0x7f0b187ec55d]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libX11.so.6(XPending+0x57)[0x7f0b187ddf47]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgdk-x11-2.0.so.0(+0x57e2e)[0x7f0aa4245e2e]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0(g_main_context_prepare+0x15d)[0x7f0b1a5dc91d]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0(+0x4a2bb)[0x7f0b1a5dd2bb]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0(g_main_context_iteration+0x2c)[0x7f0b1a5dd49c]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN20QEventDispatcherGlib13processEventsE6QFlagsIN10QEventLoop17ProcessEventsFlagEE+0x5f)[0x7f0b22dba7cf]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN10QEventLoop4execE6QFlagsINS_17ProcessEventsFlagEE+0x10a)[0x7f0b22d61b4a]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN16QCoreApplication4execEv+0x9c)[0x7f0b22d69bec]
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgazebo_gui.so.8(_ZN6gazebo3gui3runEiPPc+0x56f)[0x7f0b2343fb9f]
gzclient[0x40275c]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xf0)[0x7f0b217fa830]
gzclient(_start+0x29)[0x4029c9]
```

It is weird to me that we trigger the problem just modifying a .cc file. It could be that the ABI breakage is elsewhere.

pull_request.title: Fix ABI breakage in gazebo 8.1.0 release (issue #2279)

update.description:
The ABI checker did not detect the failure but it was easy to trigger in the `gazebo_ros_pkgs` just running an empty world. Bisecting the changes leaded me to commit 093374a .

I'm pretty sure that one of the problem was to add the overloaded method `AddPlugin`. This could break the ABI if the method was not overloaded before. However just renaming it was not enough in my testing to solve the problem and I found needed to remove also the `AddPlugins` method to solve totally the breakage.
update.title: Fix ABI breakage in gazebo 8.1.0 release (issue #2279)
